name: Concentrated Runoff / Stormwater Inputs
functionStatement:
Quantity and quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) do not generate harmful peaks or pollution pulses and instead support diverse habitat conditions and native species.
Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown:
Screening metric used to evaluate Reach inflow based on the definition and bin thresholds provided for this metric.
Runoff is minimal or well-managed, causing no significant direct inflows or pollutant pulses.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel; Channel

Method: Desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible; Field
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Use available GIS layers/imagery and/or a field screening (as applicable) to quantify or rate the metric according to the provided bin thresholds.
Count road or highway drainage outfalls per 100 m and note erosion or sediment plumes. Corroborate with available transportation layers if present.

inputs.label: Concentrated Runoff / Stormwater Inputs
inputs.type: desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible; field
inputs.helpMarkdown: State/agency datasets, GIS/imagery, and field observations (as applicable).

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: 0-1 outfall per 100 m, and no noticeable discharge effects. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 2-3 outfalls per 100 m, with some unmitigated runoff but partial buffering. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 4-5 outfalls per 100 m, with noticeable sediment or pollutant inputs. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: More than 5 outfalls per 100 m, or major highway drains with concentrated discharge. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: DOT drainage or as-built plans (where available)
